docblock.long-description:
The main hub of our login system

PHP version 5.2.17 or higher

LICENSE: TBD
Sets some basic settings for extra security Starts the session Checks last know ip to prevent hijacking
Returns the current path of the url
Returns the current page of the url
This generates a random salt to be used in a password hasing
This creates a hash of the selected password and uses a unique salt provided by genSalt function

tag.name: param
tag.description: The random salt for the password

docblock.long-description: For UIN and inital password Checks to make sure string is all numbers
This checks if the suppled password is equal to the current stored hashed password

Returns a login form that user can login with It then checks to see if the login is successful

If so create session and/or remember cookie
Check if the user is logged-in Check for session and/or cookie is set then reference it in the database to see if it is valid if so allow the user to login
Checks and sees if the session is set Similar to LoggedIn however it does not rediect the user
Resets Session and destroyes it, deletes any cookies and redirects to index
If the remember me feature is enabled and the user has selected it create a cookie for them. Log it in the database
Delete the users cookie
Logs users activity, Nothing personal.... just login times, logout times, when recover passwords have been activated All for security

tag.name: param
tag.description: What action is happening and needs logging

Creates a random string of A-Z0-9
Checks and sees if a verCode is present and that a user is try to reover a password, otherwise Lets the user Recover their password using e-mail
Chnages the selected users password
Chnages the selected users email
Delete user account
If email verification is set this handels those verifications
Creates the Admin Account on setup

docblock.description: Testify.php - a micro unit testing framework

docblock.description: A public object for storing state and other variables across test cases and method calls.

docblock.description: Executed once before the test cases are run.
Executed once after the test cases are run.
Executed for every test case, before it is run.
Executed for every test case, after it is run.

docblock.description: The Dispatcher handles incoming HTTP requests and sends back responses.
Sets the configuration options for the dispatcher.
Matches an incoming request with the supplied routes, calls the callback associated with the matched route, and sends a response.

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file vendor\VisualPHPUnit\nx\core\Dispatcher.php

docblock.description: The Request class is used to handle all data pertaining to an incoming HTTP request.
The parameters parsed from the request url.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The configuration options. Possible keys include: 'data' - the POST/PUT/DELETE data 'query' - the GET data

docblock.long-description:
The full list of request characteristics is as follows:

  • 'ajax' - XHR
  • 'delete' - DELETE REQUEST_METHOD
  • 'flash' - "Shockwave Flash" HTTP_USER_AGENT
  • 'get' - GET REQUEST_METHOD
  • 'head' - HEAD REQUEST_METHOD
  • 'mobile' - any one of the following HTTP_USER_AGENTS:
  1. 'Android'
  2. 'AvantGo'
  3. 'Blackberry'
  4. 'DoCoMo'
  5. 'iPod'
  6. 'iPhone'
  7. 'J2ME'
  8. 'NetFront'
  9. 'Nokia'
  10. 'MIDP'
  11. 'Opera Mini'
  12. 'PalmOS'
  13. 'PalmSource'
  14. 'Plucker'
  15. 'portalmmm'
  16. 'ReqwirelessWeb'
  17. 'SonyEricsson'
  18. 'Symbian'
  19. 'UP.Browser'
  20. 'Windows CE'
  21. 'Xiino'
  • 'options' - OPTIONS REQUEST_METHOD
  • 'post' - POST REQUEST_METHOD
  • 'put' - PUT REQUEST_METHOD
  • 'ssl' - HTTPS

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file vendor\VisualPHPUnit\nx\core\Request.php

docblock.description: The Response class is used to render an HTTP response.

property.name: $_statuses
property.default: array(100 => 'Continue', 101 => 'Switching Protocols', 200 => 'OK', 201 => 'Created', 202 => 'Accepted', 203 => 'Non-Authoritative Information', 204 => 'No Content', 205 => 'Reset Content', 206 => 'Partial Content', 300 => 'Multiple Choices', 301 => 'Moved Permanently', 302 => 'Found', 303 => 'See Other', 304 => 'Not Modified', 305 => 'Use Proxy', 307 => 'Temporary Redirect', 400 => 'Bad Request', 401 => 'Unauthorized', 402 => 'Payment Required', 403 => 'Forbidden', 404 => 'Not Found', 405 => 'Method Not Allowed', 406 => 'Not Acceptable', 407 => 'Proxy Authentication Required', 408 => 'Request Time-out', 409 => 'Conflict', 410 => 'Gone', 411 => 'Length Required', 412 => 'Precondition Failed', 413 => 'Request Entity Too Large', 414 => 'Request-URI Too Large', 415 => 'Unsupported Media Type', 416 => 'Requested range not satisfiable', 417 => 'Expectation Failed', 500 => 'Internal Server Error', 501 => 'Not Implemented', 502 => 'Bad Gateway', 503 => 'Service Unavailable', 504 => 'Gateway Time-out')

docblock.long-description: @var array

Possible keys include the following:

  • 'buffer_size' - The number of bytes each chunk of output should contain

docblock.description: Converts an integer status to a well-formed HTTP status header.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The integer associated with the HTTP status.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The response to be parsed. Can be an array containing 'body', 'headers', and/or 'status' keys, or a string which will be used as the body of the response. Note that the headers must be well-formed HTTP headers, and the status must be an integer (i.e., the one associated with the HTTP status code).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The response to be rendered. Can be an array containing 'body', 'headers', and/or 'status' keys, or a string which will be used as the body of the response. Note that the headers must be well-formed HTTP headers, and the status must be an integer (i.e., the one associated with the HTTP status code). The response body is chunked according to the buffer_size set in the constructor.

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file vendor\VisualPHPUnit\nx\core\Response.php

docblock.description: The Router is used to handle url routing.
Compiles the regex necessary to capture all match types within a route.
Parses the supplied request uri based on the supplied routes and the request method.
docblock.long-description:
Routes should be of the following format:

$routes = array(
    array(
        mixed $request_method, string $request_uri, callable $callback
    ),
    ...
);

where:

$request_method can be a string ('GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE'),
or an array (e.g., array('GET, 'POST')).  Note that $request_method
is case-insensitive.

$request_uri is a string, with optional match types.  Valid match types
are as follows:

[i] - integer
[a] - alphanumeric
[h] - hexadecimal
[*] - anything

Match types can be combined with parameter names, which will be
captured:

[i:id] - will match an integer, storing it within the returned 'params'
array under the 'id' key
[a:name] - will match an alphanumeric value, storing it within the
returned 'params' array under the 'name' key

Here are some examples to help illustrate:

/post/[i:id] - will match on /post/32 (with the returned 'params' array
containing an 'id' key with a value of 32), but will not match on
/post/today

/find/[h:serial] - will match on /find/ae32 (with the returned 'params'
array containing a 'serial' key will a value of 'ae32'), but will not
match on /find/john

$callback is a valid callback function.

Returns an array containing the following keys:

  • 'params' - The parameters collected from the matched uri
  • 'callback' - The callback function pulled from the matched route

parse_markers.error: No page-level DocBlock was found in file vendor\VisualPHPUnit\nx\core\Router.php
